Sequential.Optimizers

Interface Optimizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Adam, MiniBatch

    public interface Optimizer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void constructOptimizer(Sequential net)
      Gives the optimizer access to the network it needs to train.
      void trainNetwork(double[][][][] x, double[][] y, int batchSize, int epochs)
      Fit the network to an approximate mapping between the given inputs and outputs.
      void writeOpt(java.io.FileWriter fWrite)
      Serialize the optimizer.

    • Method Detail

      • trainNetwork

        void trainNetwork(double[][][][] x,
                  double[][] y,
                  int batchSize,
                  int epochs)
           throws InvalidOperationException,
                  InvalidDimensionException
        Fit the network to an approximate mapping between the given inputs and outputs.
        Parameters:
        x - Array of 3D inputs to the network for training.
        y - Array of 1D expected outputs corresponding to the inputs.
        batchSize - Number of inputs that should be in training batches.
        epochs - Number of times the inputs should be trained on.
        Throws:
        InvalidDimensionException
        InvalidOperationException

      • constructOptimizer

        void constructOptimizer(Sequential net)
        Gives the optimizer access to the network it needs to train.
        Parameters:
        net - The network the optimizer should be fitting.

      • writeOpt

        void writeOpt(java.io.FileWriter fWrite)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Serialize the optimizer.
        Parameters:
        fWrite - The FileWriter that should write the serialized form of the optimizer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
